nexttext: Here ${r_{\perp}}$ and $\phi_r$ are the polar coordinate of each initial parton (after its formation time) in the transverse plane, and ${\langle {...}\rangle}$ denotes the per-event average. We analyze the momentum-space azimuthal anisotropy of partons in the final state before hadronization, of hadrons right after hadronization before hadronic rescatterings take place, and of freeze-out hadrons in the final state. The momentum anisotropy is characterized by Fourier coefficients~\cite{Voloshin:1994mz}
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{\psi_{2}^{(r)}}=\left[{\rm atan2}({\langle{{r_{\perp}}^{2}\sin 2\phi_{r}}%
\rangle},{\langle{{r_{\perp}}^{2}\cos 2\phi_{r}}\rangle})+\pi\right]/2\,." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi>ψ</mi><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>atan2</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟨</mo><mrow><mmultiscripts><mi>r</mi><mo>⟂</mo><none/><none/><mn>2</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>ϕ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟩</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟨</mo><mrow><mmultiscripts><mi>r</mi><mo>⟂</mo><none/><none/><mn>2</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>ϕ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟩</mo></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mo>/</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mn>2</mn></mpadded></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: Here ${r_{\perp}}$ and $\phi_r$ are the polar coordinate of each initial parton (after its formation time) in the transverse plane, and ${\langle {...}\rangle}$ denotes the per-event average. We analyze the momentum-space azimuthal anisotropy of partons in the final state before hadronization, of hadrons right after hadronization before hadronic rescatterings take place, and of freeze-out hadrons in the final state. The momentum anisotropy is characterized by Fourier coefficients~\cite{Voloshin:1994mz}
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="v_{2}={\langle{\cos n(\phi-{\psi_{2}^{(r)}})}\rangle}\,," display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>ψ</mi><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">⟩</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>
